post.description: Creates a contextual app with the specified `uid`.

x-weavy.example:
curl https://{WEAVY-SERVER}/api/apps
-H "Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS-TOKEN | API-KEY}"
--json "{ 'uid': 'chat-project-x', 'type': 'chat', 'name': 'Chat for Project X' }"

parameters.name: contextual
parameters.description: `true` to lists contextual apps, `false` to list non-contextual apps; when not specified both types are listed.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Guid of app type to list.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A query used to find matching items.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: List items with the specified tag.

parameters.name: trashed
parameters.description: Indicates whether trashed items should be listed (default is `false`). Specify `null` to return both trashed and non-trashed items.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Specifies the sort order and direction for the listing, e.g. "`name`" or "`name+desc`"

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return in the listing. Should be a value between `0` and `100`. Default is `25`.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip. Used together with `top` to return a specific range of items (for pagination).

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: `false` to skip counting the total number of matching items; default is `true`.

parameters.name: count_only
parameters.description: `true` to only return the *number* of matching items; when this is specified the response will only contain the `count` property.

post.description: Initialize an app (get existing or create new) and ensure user is member (if specified).

x-weavy.example:
curl https://{WEAVY-SERVER}/api/apps/init
-H "Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS-TOKEN | API-KEY}"
--json "{'app': { 'uid': 'chat-project-x', 'type': 'chat', 'name': 'Chat for Project X' }, 'user': { 'uid': 'user-1' } }"

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of app.

parameters.name: trashed
parameters.description: `true` to return app even if trashed, otherwise `false`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of app.

x-weavy.example:
$ curl -X PATCH {WEAVY_SERVER}/api/apps/2
-H "Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS-TOKEN | API-KEY}"
-H "Content-Type: application/json"
-d "{'app': { 'uid': 'chat-project-x', 'type': 'chat', 'name': 'Chat for Project X' }, 'user': { 'uid': 'user-1' } }"

post.description:
Create a private chat or chat room.
If only one member is specified, a private chat is created (if there already is a chat between the creator and member, that instance is returned instead of creating a new chat).
If member count is more than one, a chat room is created (if name is omitted, the name of the chat will be the participant(s) names).

x-weavy.example:
curl https://{WEAVY-SERVER}/api/conversations
-H "Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS-TOKEN}"
-H "Content-Type: application/json"
-d "{ 'name': 'My chat room', 'members': [1, 4, 14] }"
            
curl https://{WEAVY-SERVER}/api/conversations
-H "Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS-TOKEN}"
-H "Content-Type: application/json"
-d "{ 'name': 'My private chat', 'members': [ 4 ] }"

x-weavy.example:
$ curl -X PUT {WEAVY_SERVER}/api/notifications/mark
-H "Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS-TOKEN}"
            
$ curl -X PUT {WEAVY_SERVER}/api/notifications/mark?id=3
-H "Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS-TOKEN}"

get.description: List notifications for the authenticated user.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: List notifications that were triggered by actions of this type, e.g. `message_created` or `comment_updated` etc.

parameters.name: unread
parameters.description: `true` lists unread notifications, `false` lists read notifications and `null` (default) lists all notifications whether they are read or not.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A query used to find matching items.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: List items with the specified tag.

parameters.name: trashed
parameters.description: Indicates whether trashed items should be listed (default is `false`). Specify `null` to return both trashed and non-trashed items.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Specifies the sort order and direction for the listing, e.g. "`name`" or "`name+desc`"

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return in the listing. Should be a value between `0` and `100`. Default is `25`.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip. Used together with `top` to return a specific range of items (for pagination).

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: `false` to skip counting the total number of matching items; default is `true`.

parameters.name: count_only
parameters.description: `true` to only return the *number* of matching items; when this is specified the response will only contain the `count` property.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the option.

post.description: Vote for a poll option.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the poll option.

get.description: List users that voted for the specified poll option.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Option id.

post.description: Creates a new post in the specified posts app.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: App id.

x-weavy.example:
curl https://{WEAVY-SERVER}/api/apps/1/posts
-H "Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS-TOKEN | API-KEY}"
-H "Content-Type: application/json"
-d "{ 'text': 'This is a post' }"

get.description: List posts in the specified posts app.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: App id.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A query used to find matching items.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: List items with the specified tag.

parameters.name: trashed
parameters.description: Indicates whether trashed items should be listed (default is `false`). Specify `null` to return both trashed and non-trashed items.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Specifies the sort order and direction for the listing, e.g. "`name`" or "`name+desc`"

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return in the listing. Should be a value between `0` and `100`. Default is `25`.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of items to skip. Used together with `top` to return a specific range of items (for pagination).

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: `false` to skip counting the total number of matching items; default is `true`.

parameters.name: count_only
parameters.description: `true` to only return the *number* of matching items; when this is specified the response will only contain the `count` property.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the post.

parameters.name: trashed
parameters.description: `true` to return post even if trashed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the post.

x-weavy.example:
$ curl -X PATCH {WEAVY_SERVER}/api/posts/1
-H "Authorization: Bearer {ACCESS-TOKEN | API-KEY}"
-H "Content-Type: application/json"
-d "{ 'text': 'This is an updated post' }"

get.description: List users based on autocomplete search.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The search phrase to use.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Gets or sets the number of items to skip before returning, defaults to `0`.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Max number of items to return, defaults to `5`.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Count the total number of search results, defaults to `false`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Optional app id. When set, the result contains a property indicating wheter the listed users are member of the specified app or not.

uid.description: A string that uniquely identifies the app, for instance a product id or URL (*cannot contain whitespace and must contain at least one non-digit*).

type.description: Type of app to create (`chat`, `files` or `posts`).

metadata.description: Additional properties to associate with the app, e.g. `{ "color": "blue", "size": "XL" }`.

tags.description: A list of tags to associate with the app.

uid.description: Gets the unique identifier for the app in the host system.

archive_url.description: Url to zip-archive with files in the app.

created_at.description: Date and time (UTC) when the app was created.

created_by_id.description: Id of the user that created the app.

modified_at.description: Date and time (UTC) when the app was last updated.

modified_by_id.description: Id of the user that last modified the app.

data.description: Gets the items on the current page.

start.description: Gets the number of the first item on this page (if the data is paged).

end.description: Gets the number of the last item on this page (if the data is paged).

count.description: Gets the total number of items in the result.

AppOutPagedListOut.description: A wrapper around a Weavy.Core.Collections.PagedList`1 for better JSON serialization.

provider.description: Gets the provider name (for external blobs).

link.description: Gets an url for viewing the blob (for external blobs).

download.description: Gets an url for downloading the blob (for external blobs).

embed.description: Gets an url used for embedding the blob (for external blobs).

raw.description: Gets the raw metadata from the provider (for external blobs).

name.description: Gets or sets the file name of the blob.

media_type.description: Gets or sets the Media Type (https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml) of the file, e.g. "image/png".

width.description: Gets the width, in pixels, of the blob (only for images).

height.description: Gets the height, in pixels, of the blob (only for images).

size.description: Gets the size, in bytes, of the file.

Blob.description: A class containing metadata about a blob.

embed.description: Gets or sets an url used for embedding the blob.

plain.description: Gets the message text with all formatting stripped.

rooms.description: Gets or sets the number of unread chat room conversations.

chat.description: Gets or sets the number of unread contextual chat conversations.

name.description: Name of room to create, or `null` to auto-generate a name based on room members.

last_message_id.description: Id of the last message in the conversation.

action.description: The event that triggered the delivery.

delivered_at.description: Time when the webhook delivery occurred.

status_code.description: Status code received when delivery was made, e.g. 200.

status.description: The response returned after attempting the delivery, e.g. "OK".

description.description: Gets or sets a description for the embed.

created_at.description: Gets the time (UTC) the embed url was fetched.

created_by_id.description: Gets the id of the user that created the embed.

host.description: Gets the name of the host/domain where the embed originates.

original_url.description: Gets the original url the user provided.

is_link.description: Gets or sets a UI hint telling the UI to render this embed as a link.

cache_age.description: Gets the cache age in seconds.

thumbnail_width.description: Gets the width of the thumbnail.

thumbnail_height.description: Gets the height of the thumbnail.

url.description: Gets the source url of the image (when EmbedType is "photo"). Consumers should be able to insert this URL into an element.

width.description: Gets the width in pixels of the embed (when EmbedType is "photo", "rich" or "video").

height.description: Gets the height in pixels of the embed (when EmbedType is "photo", "rich" or "video").

html.description: Gets the html required to display the resource (when EmbedType is "rich" or "video").

url.description: The URL to retrieve embedding information for.

PresenceStatus.description:
Enum type for user presence. 
A user can have one of two possible presence values, active or away. 
A user is active if they have at least one active client connected, and they are not manually marked as "away".

given_name.description: Given/First name(s) of user. In some cultures, people can have multiple given names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

middle_name.description: Middle name(s) of the user. In some cultures, people can have multiple middle names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

name.description: The full name in displayable form including all name parts, possibly including titles and suffixes.

family_name.description: Family/Last name(s) of user. In some cultures, people can have multiple family names or no family name; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

nickname.description: The nickname, a casual name that may or may not be the same as the Weavy.Core.DTO.ProfileUp.GivenName. For instance, a person with given name "Michael" might have the nickname "Mike".

comment.description: Comment or other application-specific information about the user.

picture.description: The user's profile picture. Can be a public URL, a base64 encoded data URI or a blob id.

directory.description: Id or name of user directory.

tags.description: A list of tags to associate with the user.

is_suspended.description: `true` to mark the user account as suspended, otherwise `false`.

ProfileUp.description: Base model used when inserting/updating users.

content.description: A single emoji character describing the reaction, e.g. '``' or '``'.

given_name.description: Given/First name(s) of user. In some cultures, people can have multiple given names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

middle_name.description: Middle name(s) of the user. In some cultures, people can have multiple middle names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

name.description: The full name in displayable form including all name parts, possibly including titles and suffixes.

family_name.description: Family/Last name(s) of user. In some cultures, people can have multiple family names or no family name; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

nickname.description: The nickname, a casual name that may or may not be the same as the Weavy.Core.DTO.ProfileUp.GivenName. For instance, a person with given name "Michael" might have the nickname "Mike".

comment.description: Comment or other application-specific information about the user.

picture.description: The user's profile picture. Can be a public URL, a base64 encoded data URI or a blob id.

directory.description: Id or name of user directory.

tags.name: Apps
tags.description: The Apps API enables you to manage apps.

tags.name: Blobs
tags.description: The Blobs API enables the uploading of blobs. Blobs are used as references when creating files and attachments and files.

tags.name: Comments
tags.description: The Comments API supports managing comments.

tags.name: Conversations
tags.description: The Conversations API has methods for creating, and managing conversations.

tags.name: Directories
tags.description: Api for user directories.

tags.name: Embeds
tags.description: The Embeds API converts URLs into embedded videos, images and rich article previews.

tags.name: Files
tags.description: The Files API has methods for managing files.

tags.name: Meetings
tags.description: The Meetings API enabled you to create meetings (which can later be attached to messages).

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: The Messages API supports managing chat messages.

tags.name: Notifications
tags.description: The Notifications API has methods for managing notifications.

tags.name: Options
tags.description: The Options API supports managing poll options.

tags.name: Posts
tags.description: The Comments API supports managing posts.

tags.name: Reactions
tags.description: The Reactions API enables you to create, list and delete reactions.

tags.name: Stars
tags.description: The Stars API enables bookmarking things for reference and/or follow-up.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: The Users API has methods for managing users.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
The Webhooks API enable you to register and manage webhooks.
You can also use the API to list webhook deliveries for a webhook.
